    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GridNode(int x, int y, int movmentFlags)
      The constructor creates a new grid node at the specified location with the given movement flags.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GridNode

        public GridNode(int x,
        int y,
        int movmentFlags)
        The constructor creates a new grid node at the specified location with the given movement flags. The movement flags are compared with the mover's movement flags in order to determine whether a particular mover can pass this node.
        Parameters:
        x - The x location of this node.
        y - The y location of this node.
        movmentFlags - The movement flags which indicate which movers can pass the node.

    • Method Detail

      • x

        public int x()
        Returns the x location of this node.
        Returns:
        The x location of this node.

      • y

        public int y()
        Returns the y location of this node.
        Returns:
        The y location of this node.

      • getMovementFlags

        public int getMovementFlags()
        Returns the movement flags for this node.
        Returns:
        The movement flags of this node.

      • setMovementFlags

        public void setMovementFlags(int movementFlags)
        Sets the movement flags for this node.
        Parameters:
        movementFlags - The new set of movement flags for this node.

      • addMovementFlags

        public void addMovementFlags(int movementFlags)
        This method masks on the given set of movement flags.
        Parameters:
        movementFlags - The set of movement flags to add to the current set.

      • removeMovementFlags

        public void removeMovementFlags(int movementFlags)
        This method masks off the given set of movement flags.
        Parameters:
        movementFlags - The set of movement flags to remove from the current set.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object aN)
        This method determines if the given object is a node and if so, whether it refers to the same grid location. Movement flags are not a part of the equality check, only location.
        Specified by:
        equals in interface IPathNode
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        aN - A node to test for equality.
        Returns:
        True if the given object is a node which refers to the same grid location.

        public int hashCode()
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object
